root: ^Don Quixote: How are you B.F.? I hear that Nathan Drake person is quite an adventurer.

c-0: ^You: I am doing fine. He is quite accomplished
c-1: ^You: I am doing fine. He is probably fun to talk to, but I think we should focus on how to get out of here.
g-0: ^Don Quixote: Who do you think is the better adventurer? Nathan or me?

c-0: ^Don Quixote: What? Sure he might have seen a few fantastic sights, but I...
c-1: ^You: I really don't know your adventures at all. Why are you asking me this?
^Don Quixote: An adventurer's inate quality does not need to be proven by accounts of adventure...
g-0: ^Don Quixote: I once fought windmills who were oppressing the locals.
^Don Quixote: Yes, they could giants in disguise.
^Now I doubt if you even are a knight

c-2: ^You: Don Quixote, you are, of course, by definition, without doubt, worse of an adventure than Nathan Drake.
c-3: ^You: Now I wonder you are who you say you are. Are you a knight? Really?

g-1: ^Don Quixote: Oh you, get out of my face!
